intro: Cybianthus surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam beauty, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, tropical environments. Cybianthus surinamensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
